narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: great breadth and depth
You can get by doing literally nothing for the entire semester in this course, which is a shame - the material is interesting and could benefit from group discussions/debates.

The course was well organized and the lectures were clear and well prepared--there was a lot of repetition however and the class could have moved more quickly. There were no assignments until the final to keep you engaged or encourage you to do the reading. Not a difficult or deep class but a good intro into management concepts for those like me who have not had much before.

This course fulfilled a bin requirement for me, and the work was minimal. I had low expectations for the class. Professor Ramsey was excellent. Professor Esty tended to repeat concepts without going over new material, and that was frustrating.

Question 3Except for the final paper due at the end of the semester, and the readings due each class, there were no other assignments in this course. At least a couple of exercises assigned throughout the semester, meant to highlight important concepts and point students in teh right direction, would be helpful.Question 5Prof. Esty spent little time on student questions or comments. He acknowledged them, but he would usually continue with his previous line of thought and move to the next point very quickly. Prof. Ramsey was only slightly better in this regard.

One of the things I liked about the course was that we often had guest lecturers.The experiences from people working in important companies complemented the course and gave us the opportunity to exchange questions and comments.
I enjoyed getting different prospectives from the different lecturers.
lecture diversity and topic integration
Case studies
Great speakers
Getting to hear from guest speakers such as Jerry Greenfield (Ben and Jerry's) or Gary Sheffer (GE) about social responsibility and how businesses deal with it.
Understanding CSR from GE's perspective. Getting a useful framework for strategy through Green to Gold. Excellent guest speakers.
a good way of thinking to analysis environmental management issue.
Lectures were engaging, outside speakers were interesting. It was a good basic overview of the topic for someone who knows very little about the business world.

It was not a lot of work and the concepts were clearly presented and discussed--a good introduction into principles of green business and management strategy. Both professors are knowledgeable and well prepared for lecture, good at keeping the discussion moving and well directed. Slides are clear and well prepared.
The light workload and the clear framework that Dan Esty follows meant the course was very easy.

The case studies used to illustrate concepts and ideas were very helpful. The two brief visits by practitioners and professionals (Jerry from Ben and Jerry's Ice Cream, and the fellow discussing GE's clean up of the Hudson) were refreshing and very instructive. The exercise we were assigned with CitiBank and Rainforest Alliance was fun and useful.
real world applications
The lecturers and that the cases that we studied.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Maybe have more exercises like the Rainforest Action Network/Citigroup one

At the start of the course, Professor Esty said that the class would be very discussion oriented - especially for case studies. I am unsure if it was because of the general reticence of class members, but I was disappointed by the level of discussion that the instructors engendered.
NA

Hold us accountable/make sure we don't run out of time for case study discussions. I really feel like we would learn more if we engaged the readings and had to think critically. We did this with the RAN exercise and I thought it was great.
I wish there had been more assignments and opportunities to apply the information we learned in class.
Engage students more -- perhaps with assignments.

I thought that the time allocated for discussing case studies was very short. Usually it was just the last 20 minutes of class, and more often than not the instructor would talk about the case.There is a lot of emphasis in class about being data driven to back your analysis and thinking. It would have been more helpful if we discussed more about data analysis and how each company tackled the problems they faced based on the numbers at hand.
Perhaps more hands-on case studies, where students pick apart topics. More hands-on training working with companies on specific problems.
field trip or more simulating activities will be great
I was disappointed that the field trip to Stonyfield Farms was cut this year.

The pace was a little slow and there was some repetition of the main concepts in many lectures. If you have a lot of background in economics or business it was a little shallow. An assignment or two to keep people engaged would be good as well. A little more direction on what they are looking for in the final might be helpful as well.
Professory Esty should not cite the same examples over and over again. Having other examples and cases involving smaller-scale companies would have been more useful.

There must be more substantial involvement with the students during class. There were always the few students that constantly spoke, but most of the class could keep very quiet with few repercussions.The course could progress more quicly into complex cases: the first few weeks of the course were overwhelmingly repetitive, with Prof. Esty deliniating almost exactly the readings previously assigned for homework.Towards the middle and end of the course, substantial sections of the syllabus went undiscussed in class due to lack of time.I did not find the material challenging, or the readings burdensome. It would be possible, and probably very beneficial, to limit the lecturing and have instead much more discussion about the readings, their implications, and how they relate to student experiences. The class was listed among three schools, with a variety of students in different fields, with different professional backgrounds... the class should take advantage of its students to complement and enrich the curriculum.
The course could be improved adding more class exercises.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: I understand that Prof. Esty is extremely busy, and I feel he tries hard to make sure he is available to us.
NA
The TAs worked their tails off - they're amazing. Also, their previous work/educational experiences were directly relevant to the course materials which was really great.
Professor Ramsey was great with feedback.
Both the TAs and the instructors were very approachable. However, it was difficult to reach one of the instructors for one month in the semseter.
Help wasn't really needed throughout the semester. It was a shame that TA's couldn't really help with the assignment, though this was understandable. They were great, nonetheless.
They are good and helpful.
TAs were very responsive and kept in good communication with the class.
I contacted and spoke with both TAs on various occasions. Anna and Cat were both helpful, accessible and courteous.
great
The availability and quality of the instructors and TAs was excellent.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: it is great to see what other stakeholders face
Students should be given short assignments.
This course lays the foundation for other advanced ones such as the Business and Environment Clinic. The course is also a primer for my career goals.
Very interested in the business-environment interface.
It fits my program because I concentrate on law and policy. This class provide opportunity to understand the relationship between business and environment, which is very helpful to police-making.
Filled a bin requirement and seemed the easiest way to do it. But I think I did learn some concepts by the end and it was pretty painless.

This course does not fit into my overall program. I am not at all interested in corporate environmental management or consulting. If anything, it gives me a peek into how the business world may think.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I wanted to get insights into the environmental movement from the corporate world. I felt this class did a fantastic job providing real world practical insights into environmental management in the corporate context. It was exactly what I wanted.
gain different perspective
Mostly because of the professors. They've done some incredible things and are a great resource.
Interest in how to incorporate environmental activities into everyday activities.
I hope to work as a consultant after I graduate and this course is a great starting point for me.
Enjoyed reading Green to Gold over the summer. Esty and Ramsey provide very valuable insights and bring a perspective that overlaps with Law and SOM.
I am interested in it.
I took the course to fulfill an MEM bin requirement - it's not particularly related to my area of study.
Filled a bin requirement, seemed like an easy course, which it was. Seemed more interesting than some of the other business courses.
It fulfilled a bin requirement.
learn about business
I wanted to learn about companies and the role private sector's actions influence the environment.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes.
yes
no. I was disappointed. Not by the readings/materials, but by the lack of discussion in class. Perhaps this was because it was at 8.30 in the morning...? ha
It did not exceed my expectations.
Yes, it did.
Yes, it was great.
yes
Yes, it was a good overview of the topic, a good fit for someone like me with little experience with the business world.
Yes, though my expectations were pretty low. I learned some concepts and got a good introduction into the world of green business and didn't have to put too much work into it.
Yes. I had low expectations.
Yes
yes

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes.
yes
no, I expected to get a bit more out of it.
Not really.
I learned a lot from this course and it met all my expectations.
A good understanding of the issues. However, as stated I would like to have developed some more practical skills related to actually advising companies.
yes
The lectures were pretty engaging and held my interest, so overall better than I expected. I did learn some concepts as well.
Yes. I can recite Esty's Green to Gold framework and apply it if need be.
yes

Yes, learned a lot about companies because of the many cases we reviewed and analyzed. I now understand how important is understanding companies strengthening partnerships with them to address environmental problems.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Advantage: fun, hands on application of the concepts were were hearing about in lecture.Disadvantage: not enough hands on exercises like the above.
great opportunity to connect ideas
n/a
Enjoyed this class exercise - perhaps one more like this in the term would be useful. Could make it a more extended piece and encourage groups to meet up between classes to plan more thoroughly.
N/A

We had one quick group assignment which was interesting--more projects and group work would have been good. That was the only interactive part of the class and I liked the opportunity to discuss the material and learn from others that had more background in the topic.
The group work was short and quick, which was nice. Not too involved.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: I would encourage them to take the class and enjoy it.
take good notes
do all the readings - they're really great - and explore more online/in other resources. the stuff is great.
This class wasmore conceptual than deliverable focus.
This course does not have a midterm. The only area where a student is tested is in the final strategy plan for a real world company. Therefore it is really important to participate actively in class.
Read Green to Gold!
participate in class as much as possible, you will be inspired.

Don't expect a really deep or challenging course, but if the material is new it might be worth it as a good introductory course. Good way to get a Bin 6 requirement. If you put a lot into doing all the reading and asking questions you will get the most out of it, but if you don't want to do the reading most of it is covered in lecture anyway. Just read Green to Gold and you are fine.
Don't take it too seriously.
be involved in the class discussions
